Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2011 11:41AM MustangSally67 wrote: So the update is am ER/PR + and HER2 negative. I have decided to have a bilat mx in Sept. Margins were clear with biopsy and I had the dye yesterday and it showed nothing new. They will biopsy the nodes when they do the mastectomy. It is SOOO crazy to me that this is happening and I know it sounds aggressive to a lot of my friends. I think they are in shock and it hits to close to home for them. I have done some research but am trying not to overwhelm myself. I am NOT getting a second opinion... I really feel good with the people I am working with. Is that crazy? I mean my gut tells me this is the right choice for me, and getting several other opinions will only cloud the issues for me. I trust my Doc and have no reason to believe she doesn't have my best interests in mind, or that she doesn't know what she is doing. She has been in practice for 20 yrs and is very well respected in the NW.   I have implants now, so what do I care if I get new ones? I am NOT attached to me breasts now and just want what is best for the long term. I will be getting my oldest started in first grade on Sept 6th and then have surgery 9 days later. At least I will be available his first week of school.

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2008 04:14PM mustangsally wrote: It seems everyone that has responded has given you accurate information but if you need more information try this site http://www.facingourrisk.org/ It was very informative for me since I didn't know my family history and have two teen girls.  Although there are negatives to knowing the results there are also positives. The most and only reason I had the test done was so my children could plan their futures with all the facts. It cost $3k but my insurance covered it.  Good luck with your research and give it a lot of thought. MS
